info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 12:45AM CDT until July 9 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Lingering flooding from earlier heavy rainfall.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, Cook.
* WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. Slow moving or standing water may continue.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1242 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding in the advisory area due to earlier thunderstorms, which produced between 2 and 5.5 inches of rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, West Town, Bridgeport, South Lawndale, Chicago Loop, Austin, Navy Pier, Northerly Island, Near West Side, Near North Side, Humboldt Park, Brighton Park, East Garfield Park, Lower West Side, North Lawndale, Near South Side, Douglas, West Garfield Park and McKinley Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING
